snippet: Eliot Spitzer’s bid to run for New York City comptroller is unnerving on many levels.
abstract: Editorial argues Eliot Spitzer's return to politics is unnerving not only because of prostitution scandal, but because of his colossal failures during brief tenure as governor of New York; holds New Yorkers deserve better than Spitzer, who, like Anthony Weiner, has chosen the quick and easy path to redemption.
lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer’s bid to run for New York City comptroller is unnerving on many levels.
